text: Emily Gerdes (sometimes credited as Emma Gerdes) was an American character actress active primarily during Hollywood's silent era. == Biography == Emily was born in Jefferson, Kansas, to Herman Gerdes (a veterinarian) and Mary Ellen Glaze. The family soon moved to Missouri and then Arizona before later settling in Glendale, California. Her parents later divorced. In Los Angeles, Emily began appearing in films; her first known credit was in 1917's Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm. == Selected filmography == * The Grapes of Wrath (1940) * Banjo on My Knee (1936) * Heroes of the Wild (1927) * Ella Cinders (1926) * Dynamite Dan (1924) * Behind Two Guns (1924) * Bell Boy 13 (1923) * Puppy Love (1919) * A Lady's Name (1918) * How Could You, Jean? (1918) * Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm (1917) == References == Category:American actresses Category:American film actresses Category:1890 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Actresses from Kansas
title: Emily Gerdes
